title: Vivian
summary: The Lady of the Lake, also known as Vivian or Nimue, according to legend, she is most famous for giving Arthur the magical sword Excalibur, for fostering Sir Lancelot after his father's death and for imprisoning Merlin in a Tower or Tree or at times; a Cave.

title: Astrid Diamantopoulou
summary: Astrid Diamantopoulou, also known as Blue Stargazer, is the acting head of the Diamantis Family and supporting heroine of Fate/Revelation. She appears as the protagonist of Fate/Astra in her youth. She once sought to fulfill the Grand Order of her Family as was expected of her, but she came to develop her own Grand Order, and cast her gaze on the starry seas.

title: Celeste Turgard
summary: To be reworked, the False Valkyrie of The Thule.

title: Hina Hasegawa
summary: The Shadow of Arasaka is somebody that most people don‚Äôt agree on the existence of. From time to time, the Shadow will be brought up as a horror story that spread around to discourage action against Arasaka. Others believe it to just be a story based on a long past person. The truth is uncertain, what is certain is that the Shadow of Arasaka is only a story that can be told in full by those sitting at the top of their respective Corporations.

title: Sophia Tokunaga
summary: A Freelance Media often known under the handle of ‚ÄúHarmony‚Äù and recognized by her special insignia. She is often the source behind big stories exposing the misdeeds of corpos yet is rarely the one running the story herself. Often selling off stories to media outlets who‚Äôd find benefit in running stories that negatively impact the reputation of rival corpos for little pay. She rather asks for the condition of being given explicit credit as a source over high pay for those stories..

title: 'Soo-Mi'
summary: Soo-Mi is a Messenger and Diplomat under Kyo‚Äôs employ, but in truth, she mostly acts as a Mediator amongst Lycans in spite of her not being a Werewolf. title: Orlok D. Erzs√©bet
summary: Orlok D. Erzs√©bet is an original character within the story of Dreams Adrift. She is a B+ ranking Driftwood Pirate whose fixated on the idea of permanence. Yet even with her fixation on permanence, she doesn‚Äôt seem to care about her own life‚Äîas if dying isn‚Äôt a fear she has. An action only taken for it is rational to seek permanence. To achieve permanence and thus security. An extreme rational egoist to her core that is willing to commit countless atrocities for as long as it has purpose. Many believe her goal to be defying the natural order and attaining ‚ÄúDivinity‚Äù for immortality‚Ä¶yet in truth‚Äîthe only way to attain absolute Divinity is when you are the only divinity left on the board.

title: Cordelia
summary: The eternal ray of sunlight that once shone all across the lands, once known as a pure and kind Faeri even amongst her own kind. One who held no judgement or hatred in her heart toward any, even lending her light to the likes of the Daemon-Kind. With her faith in hand, many saw her as the perfect ideal of morality. One whose light was to be followed as an example. Yet, she who wished to heal the world and aid all the land, was one burdened with great pain and sorrow...A fallen angel.

summary: Marie-√âl√©onore Ad√©la√Øde De Clermont-Tonnerre (‚ÄúThe Bitter Light of a Stolen Grace, a High Beacon that hides the Storm of the Grave.‚Äù) is a haematophage of the Vampiric Species, proclaiming herself an eloquent noble lady and veiling herself in lavish attires‚Äîplaying a variety of music and practicing what she describes as a ‚Äúcivilized way of life.‚Äù All in hopes of being able to maintain a sense of humanity; to separate herself from that of a wild haematophagic beast, and ‚Äúchange.‚Äù

title: Vera
summary: Vera Propitia can be read as ‚ÄúThe Grace Of yielding Law‚Äù or more symbolically as ‚ÄúThe Hollow Benediction.‚Äù Propitia is her family name, and Vera was her mother‚Äôs wish for her. To be faithful and true to herself. It is an irony for her, whose very name can be read to reflect her true self‚Äîcontradictory to her mother‚Äôs wishes‚Äîan empty husk of a person. Somebody who lives only by the ideal they were shaped by and for, that of Magic, and nothing more. Or perhaps she was empty from the moment she was born.
